column4: hello I have dell laptop and I have and update my BIOS from the time i bought it, more than 2 years how could I update my BIOS  do I have to find each update chronologically and apply them one by one or the latest one suffice
each bios "package" should contain the COMPLETE BIOS
so the latest one is enough
how should i do It use ubuntu and have no windows access?
your laptop should have some method of "flashing" it in... EG: writing it to a CD, having it on a flash drive, writing it onto a floppy disk
`you mean I do not have to install windows and the install BOIS update software on it?
there are usually multiple ways to update bios...
try finding some documentation on how to do it outside of windows.
for example, my ATOM motherboard supports doing it in windows, out of a CD, out of a flash drive, booting off of a "special" OS, and "backup mode"
it just says: TWO ways: for windows and ssecond the dos mode for non-windows user..
you can write a CD with DOS in it and write it that way...
